TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed SecurityAction extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the security actions that can be performed using declarative security.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A tabela a seguir descreve o tempo que leva de cada ação de segurança local e os destinos que ele suporta.
> [!IMPORTANT] > No [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], suporte de tempo de execução foi removido para impor as solicitações de permissão Deny e RequestRefuse, RequestOptional e RequestMinimum. Essas solicitações não devem ser usadas no código que é baseado no [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)] ou posterior. Para obter mais informações sobre essa e outras alterações, consulte [alterações de segurança](~/docs/framework/security/security-changes.md).
Você deve não useLinkDemand no [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. Em vez disso, use o <xref:System.Security.SecurityCriticalAttribute> para restringir o uso de aplicativos totalmente confiáveis, ou usar a demanda para restringir os chamadores parcialmente confiáveis.
|Declaração de ação de segurança|Hora da ação|Destinos com suporte| |------------------------------------|--------------------|-----------------------| |`LinkDemand` (não use o [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)])|Compilação Just-in-time|Método de classe| |`InheritanceDemand`|Tempo de carregamento|Método de classe| |`Demand`|Tempo de execução|Método de classe| |`Assert`|Tempo de execução|Método de classe| |`Deny` (obsoleto no [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)])|Tempo de execução|Método de classe| |`PermitOnly`|Tempo de execução|Método de classe| |`RequestMinimum` (obsoleto no [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)])|Tempo de concessão|Assembly| |`RequestOptional` (obsoleto no [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)])|Tempo de concessão|Assembly| |`RequestRefuse` (obsoleto no [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)])|Tempo de concessão|Assembly|
Para obter informações adicionais sobre os destinos de atributo, consulte <xref:System.Attribute>.
## Examples Este exemplo mostra como notificar o CLR código em métodos chamados tem apenas <xref:System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStoragePermission>e também demonstra como gravar e ler do armazenamento isolado.
[!code-cpp[IsolatedStoragePermissionAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/IsolatedStoragePermissionAttribute/cpp/IsolatedStoragePermissionAttribute.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[IsolatedStoragePermissionAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/IsolatedStoragePermissionAttribute/CS/IsolatedStoragePermissionAttribute.cs#1)] [!code-vb[IsolatedStoragePermissionAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/IsolatedStoragePermissionAttribute/VB/program.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction Assert = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The calling code can access the resource identified by the current permission object, even if callers higher in the stack have not been granted permission to access the resource (see [Using the Assert Method](~/docs/framework/misc/using-the-assert-method.md)).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction Demand = int32(2)

Docs.summary: All callers higher in the call stack are required to have been granted the permission specified by the current permission object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction Deny = int32(4)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This requests should not be used")

Docs.summary: The ability to access the resource specified by the current permission object is denied to callers, even if they have been granted permission to access it (see [Using the Deny Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/6b4d2e01-c504-4ac3-b50e-d6f5e7f5df25)).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction InheritanceDemand = int32(7)

Docs.summary: The derived class inheriting the class or overriding a method is required to have been granted the specified permission..

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction LinkDemand = int32(6)

Docs.summary: The immediate caller is required to have been granted the specified permission. Do not use in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)]. For full trust, use instead; for partial trust, use .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction PermitOnly = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Only the resources specified by this permission object can be accessed, even if the code has been granted permission to access other resources.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction RequestMinimum = int32(8)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This requests should not be used")

Docs.summary: The request for the minimum permissions required for code to run. This action can only be used within the scope of the assembly.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction RequestOptional = int32(9)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This requests should not be used")

Docs.summary: The request for additional permissions that are optional (not required to run). This request implicitly refuses all other permissions not specifically requested. This action can only be used within the scope of the assembly.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction RequestRefuse = int32(10)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This requests should not be used")

Docs.summary: The request that permissions that might be misused will not be granted to the calling code. This action can only be used within the scope of the assembly.
